source.title: An integrative theory of locus coeruleus-norepinephrine function: adaptive gain and optimal performance

confidence_rationale: Strongly supports an interrupt/arousal control channel with separable network-level gain effects.

mapping.source_claim_statement: LC-NE dynamics regulate exploration-exploitation mode and global gain control, affecting responsiveness to salient change.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports a distinct arousal/interrupt axis in Q-017, separate from precision/value and persistence axes.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Focuses on one axis; does not by itself validate a minimal complete REE axis set.
mapping.source_context: Review synthesizing electrophysiology, behavior, and systems-level control effects.

confidence_components.notes: Well-cited synthesis; good fit to interrupt-priority control interpretation.
